00030 // SetListsOnly()
00031 //
00032 // If set to true, will return an optimized list, with no strips at all.
00033 //
00034 // Default value: false
00035 //
00036 void SetListsOnly( const bool _bListsOnly )
00037 {
00038         bListsOnly = _bListsOnly;

00042 // SetCacheSize()
00043 //
00044 // Sets the cache size which the stripfier uses to optimize the data.
00045 // Controls the length of the generated individual strips.
00046 // This is the "actual" cache size, so 24 for GeForce3 and 16 for GeForce1/2
00047 // You may want to play around with this number to tweak performance.
00048 //
00049 // Default value: 16
00050 //
00051 void SetCacheSize( const unsigned int _cacheSize )
00052 {
00053         cacheSize = _cacheSize;
00054 }

00056 
00058 // SetStitchStrips()
00059 //
00060 // bool to indicate whether to stitch together strips into one huge strip or not.
00061 // If set to true, you'll get back one huge strip stitched together using degenerate
00062 //  triangles.
00063 // If set to false, you'll get back a large number of separate strips.
00064 //
00065 // Default value: true
00066 //
00067 void SetStitchStrips( const bool _bStitchStrips )
00068 {
00069         bStitchStrips = _bStitchStrips;
00070 }

00074 // SetMinStripSize()
00075 //
00076 // Sets the minimum acceptable size for a strip, in triangles.
00077 // All strips generated which are shorter than this will be thrown into one big, separate list.
00078 //
00079 // Default value: 0
00080 //
00081 void SetMinStripSize( const unsigned int _minStripSize )
00082 {
00083         minStripSize = _minStripSize;

00088 //Cleanup strips / faces, used by generatestrips
00089 void Cleanup( NvStripInfoVec& tempStrips, NvFaceInfoVec& tempFaces )
00090 {
00091         //delete strips
00092         int i = 0;
00093         for( ; i < tempStrips.size(); i++ )
00094         {
00095                 for( int j = 0; j < tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces.size(); j++ )
00096                 {
00097                         delete tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces[ j ];
00098                         tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces[ j ] = NULL;
00099                 }
00100                 tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces.resize( 0 );
00101                 delete tempStrips[ i ];
00102                 tempStrips[ i ] = NULL;
00103         }
00104 
00105         //delete faces
00106         for( i = 0; i < tempFaces.size(); i++ )
00107         {
00108                 delete tempFaces[ i ];
00109                 tempFaces[ i ] = NULL;
00110         }
00111 }

00115 //SameTriangle()
00116 //
00117 //Returns true if the two triangles defined by firstTri and secondTri are the same
00118 // The "same" is defined in this case as having the same indices with the same winding order
00119 //
00120 bool SameTriangle( unsigned short firstTri0, unsigned short firstTri1, unsigned short firstTri2, 
00121                                   unsigned short secondTri0, unsigned short secondTri1, unsigned short secondTri2 )
00122 {
00123         bool isSame = false;
00124 
00125         if ( firstTri0 == secondTri0 )
00126         {
00127                 if ( firstTri1 == secondTri1 )
00128                 {
00129                         if ( firstTri2 == secondTri2 )
00130                                 isSame = true;
00131                 }
00132         }
00133         else if ( firstTri0 == secondTri1 )
00134         {
00135                 if ( firstTri1 == secondTri2 )
00136                 {
00137                         if ( firstTri2 == secondTri0 )
00138                                 isSame = true;
00139                 }
00140         }
00141         else if ( firstTri0 == secondTri2 )
00142         {
00143                 if ( firstTri1 == secondTri0 )
00144                 {
00145                         if ( firstTri2 == secondTri1 )
00146                                 isSame = true;
00147                 }
00148         }
00149 
00150         return isSame;
00151 }

00154 bool TestTriangle( const unsigned short v0, const unsigned short v1, const unsigned short v2, const std::vector<NvFaceInfo>* in_bins, const int NUMBINS )
00155 {
00156         //hash this triangle
00157         bool isLegit = false;
00158         int ctr = v0 % NUMBINS;
00159         for ( int k = 0; k < in_bins[ ctr ].size(); ++k )
00160         {
00161                 //check triangles in this bin
00162                 if ( SameTriangle( in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v0, in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v1, in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v2, 
00163                         v0, v1, v2 ) )
00164                 {
00165                         isLegit = true;
00166                         break;
00167                 }
00168         }
00169         if ( !isLegit )
00170         {
00171                 ctr = v1 % NUMBINS;
00172                 for ( int k = 0; k < in_bins[ ctr ].size(); ++k )
00173                 {
00174                         //check triangles in this bin
00175                         if ( SameTriangle( in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v0, in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v1, in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v2, 
00176                                 v0, v1, v2 ) )
00177                         {
00178                                 isLegit = true;
00179                                 break;
00180                         }
00181                 }
00182                 
00183                 if ( !isLegit )
00184                 {
00185                         ctr = v2 % NUMBINS;
00186                         for ( int k = 0; k < in_bins[ ctr ].size(); ++k )
00187                         {
00188                                 //check triangles in this bin
00189                                 if ( SameTriangle( in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v0, in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v1, in_bins[ ctr ][ k ].m_v2, 
00190                                         v0, v1, v2 ) )
00191                                 {
00192                                         isLegit = true;
00193                                         break;
00194                                 }
00195                         }
00196                         
00197                 }
00198         }
00199 
00200         return isLegit;
00201 }

00205 // GenerateStrips()
00206 //
00207 // in_indices: input index list, the indices you would use to render
00208 // in_numIndices: number of entries in in_indices
00209 // primGroups: array of optimized/stripified PrimitiveGroups
00210 // numGroups: number of groups returned
00211 //
00212 // Be sure to call delete[] on the returned primGroups to avoid leaking mem
00213 //
00214 bool GenerateStrips( const unsigned short* in_indices, const unsigned int in_numIndices,
00215                                         PrimitiveGroup** primGroups, unsigned short* numGroups, bool validateEnabled )
00216 {
00217         //put data in format that the stripifier likes
00218         WordVec tempIndices;
00219         tempIndices.resize( in_numIndices );
00220         unsigned short maxIndex = 0;
00221         unsigned short minIndex = 0xFFFF;
00222         for( int i = 0; i < in_numIndices; i++ )
00223         {
00224                 tempIndices[ i ] = in_indices[ i ];
00225                 if ( in_indices[ i ] > maxIndex )
00226                         maxIndex = in_indices[ i ];
00227                 if ( in_indices[ i ] < minIndex )
00228                         minIndex = in_indices[ i ];
00229         }
00230         NvStripInfoVec tempStrips;
00231         NvFaceInfoVec tempFaces;
00232 
00233         NvStripifier stripifier;
00234         
00235         //do actual stripification
00236         stripifier.Stripify( tempIndices, cacheSize, minStripSize, maxIndex, tempStrips, tempFaces );
00237 
00238         //stitch strips together
00239         IntVec stripIndices;
00240         unsigned int numSeparateStrips = 0;
00241 
00242         if( bListsOnly )
00243         {
00244                 //if we're outputting only lists, we're done
00245                 *numGroups = 1;
00246                 ( *primGroups ) = new PrimitiveGroup[ *numGroups ];
00247                 PrimitiveGroup* primGroupArray = *primGroups;
00248 
00249                 //count the total number of indices
00250                 unsigned int numIndices = 0;
00251                 int i = 0;
00252                 for( ; i < tempStrips.size(); i++ )
00253                 {
00254                         numIndices += tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces.size() * 3;
00255                 }
00256 
00257                 //add in the list
00258                 numIndices += tempFaces.size() * 3;
00259 
00260                 primGroupArray[ 0 ].type       = PT_LIST;
00261                 primGroupArray[ 0 ].numIndices = numIndices;
00262                 primGroupArray[ 0 ].indices    = new unsigned short[ numIndices ];
00263 
00264                 //do strips
00265                 unsigned int indexCtr = 0;
00266                 for( i = 0; i < tempStrips.size(); i++ )
00267                 {
00268                         for( int j = 0; j < tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces.size(); j++ )
00269                         {
00270                                 //degenerates are of no use with lists
00271                                 if( !NvStripifier::IsDegenerate( tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces[ j ] ) )
00272                                 {
00273                                         primGroupArray[ 0 ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces[ j ]->m_v0;
00274                                         primGroupArray[ 0 ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces[ j ]->m_v1;
00275                                         primGroupArray[ 0 ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempStrips[ i ]->m_faces[ j ]->m_v2;
00276                                 }
00277                                 else
00278                                 {
00279                                         //we've removed a tri, reduce the number of indices
00280                                         primGroupArray[ 0 ].numIndices -= 3;
00281                                 }
00282                         }
00283                 }
00284 
00285                 //do lists
00286                 for( i = 0; i < tempFaces.size(); i++ )
00287                 {                       
00288                         primGroupArray[ 0 ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempFaces[ i ]->m_v0;
00289                         primGroupArray[ 0 ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempFaces[ i ]->m_v1;
00290                         primGroupArray[ 0 ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempFaces[ i ]->m_v2;
00291                 }
00292         }
00293         else
00294         {
00295                 stripifier.CreateStrips( tempStrips, stripIndices, bStitchStrips, numSeparateStrips, bRestart, restartVal );
00296 
00297                 //if we're stitching strips together, we better get back only one strip from CreateStrips()
00298                 assert( ( bStitchStrips && ( numSeparateStrips == 1 ) ) || !bStitchStrips );
00299                 
00300                 //convert to output format
00301                 *numGroups = numSeparateStrips; //for the strips
00302                 if( tempFaces.size() != 0 )
00303                         ( *numGroups )++;  //we've got a list as well, increment
00304                 ( *primGroups ) = new PrimitiveGroup[ *numGroups ];
00305                 
00306                 PrimitiveGroup* primGroupArray = *primGroups;
00307                 
00308                 //first, the strips
00309                 int startingLoc = 0;
00310                 for( int stripCtr = 0; stripCtr < numSeparateStrips; stripCtr++ )
00311                 {
00312                         int stripLength = 0;
00313 
00314                         if( !bStitchStrips )
00315                         {
00316                                 //if we've got multiple strips, we need to figure out the correct length
00317                                 int i = startingLoc;
00318                                 for( ; i < stripIndices.size(); i++ )
00319                                 {
00320                                         if( stripIndices[ i ] == -1 )
00321                                                 break;
00322                                 }
00323                                 
00324                                 stripLength = i - startingLoc;
00325                         }
00326                         else
00327                                 stripLength = stripIndices.size();
00328                         
00329                         primGroupArray[ stripCtr ].type       = PT_STRIP;
00330                         primGroupArray[ stripCtr ].indices    = new unsigned short[ stripLength ];
00331                         primGroupArray[ stripCtr ].numIndices = stripLength;
00332                         
00333                         int indexCtr = 0;
00334                         for( int i = startingLoc; i < stripLength + startingLoc; i++ )
00335                                 primGroupArray[ stripCtr ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = stripIndices[ i ];
00336 
00337                         //we add 1 to account for the -1 separating strips
00338                         //this doesn't break the stitched case since we'll exit the loop
00339                         startingLoc += stripLength + 1; 
00340                 }
00341                 
00342                 //next, the list
00343                 if( tempFaces.size() != 0 )
00344                 {
00345                         int faceGroupLoc = ( *numGroups ) - 1;    //the face group is the last one
00346                         primGroupArray[ faceGroupLoc ].type       = PT_LIST;
00347                         primGroupArray[ faceGroupLoc ].indices    = new unsigned short[ tempFaces.size() * 3 ];
00348                         primGroupArray[ faceGroupLoc ].numIndices = tempFaces.size() * 3;
00349                         int indexCtr = 0;
00350                         for( int i = 0; i < tempFaces.size(); i++ )
00351                         {
00352                                 primGroupArray[ faceGroupLoc ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempFaces[ i ]->m_v0;
00353                                 primGroupArray[ faceGroupLoc ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempFaces[ i ]->m_v1;
00354                                 primGroupArray[ faceGroupLoc ].indices[ indexCtr++ ] = tempFaces[ i ]->m_v2;
00355                         }
00356                 }
00357         }
00358 
00359         //validate generated data against input
00360         if ( validateEnabled )
00361         {
00362                 const int NUMBINS = 100;
00363 
00364                 std::vector<NvFaceInfo> in_bins[ NUMBINS ];
00365                 
00366                 //hash input indices on first index
00367                 int i = 0;
00368                 for ( ; i < in_numIndices; i += 3 )
00369                 {
00370                         NvFaceInfo faceInfo( in_indices[ i ], in_indices[ i + 1 ], in_indices[ i + 2 ] );
00371                         in_bins[ in_indices[ i ] % NUMBINS ].push_back( faceInfo );
00372                 }
00373                 
00374                 for ( i = 0; i < *numGroups; ++i )
00375                 {
00376                         switch ( ( *primGroups )[ i ].type )
00377                         {
00378                                 case PT_LIST:
00379                                 {
00380                                         for ( int j = 0; j < ( *primGroups )[ i ].numIndices; j += 3 )
00381                                         {
00382                                                 unsigned short v0 = ( *primGroups )[ i ].indices[ j ];
00383                                                 unsigned short v1 = ( *primGroups )[ i ].indices[ j + 1 ];
00384                                                 unsigned short v2 = ( *primGroups )[ i ].indices[ j + 2 ];
00385                                                 
00386                                                 //ignore degenerates
00387                                                 if ( NvStripifier::IsDegenerate( v0, v1, v2 ) )
00388                                                         continue;
00389 
00390                                                 if ( !TestTriangle( v0, v1, v2, in_bins, NUMBINS ) )
00391                                                 {
00392                                                         Cleanup( tempStrips, tempFaces );
00393                                                         return false;
00394                                                 }
00395                                         }
00396                                         break;
00397                                 }
00398 
00399                                 case PT_STRIP:
00400                                 {
00401                                         int brokenCtr = 0;
00402                                         bool flip = false;
00403                                         for ( int j = 2; j < ( *primGroups )[ i ].numIndices; ++j )
00404                                         {
00405                                                 unsigned short v0 = ( *primGroups )[ i ].indices[ j - 2 ];
00406                                                 unsigned short v1 = ( *primGroups )[ i ].indices[ j - 1 ];
00407                                                 unsigned short v2 = ( *primGroups )[ i ].indices[ j ];
00408                                                 
00409                                                 if ( flip )
00410                                                 {
00411                                                         //swap v1 and v2
00412                                                         unsigned short swap = v1;
00413                                                         v1 = v2;
00414                                                         v2 = swap;
00415                                                 }
00416 
00417                                                 //ignore degenerates
00418                                                 if ( NvStripifier::IsDegenerate( v0, v1, v2 ) )
00419                                                 {
00420                                                         flip = !flip;
00421                                                         continue;
00422                                                 }
00423 
00424                                                 if ( !TestTriangle( v0, v1, v2, in_bins, NUMBINS ) )
00425                                                 {
00426                                                         Cleanup( tempStrips, tempFaces );
00427                                                         return false;
00428                                                 }
00429 
00430                                                 flip = !flip;
00431                                         }
00432                                         break;
00433                                 }
00434 
00435                                 case PT_FAN:
00436                                 default:
00437                                         break;
00438                         }
00439                 }
00440 
00441         }
00442 
00443         //clean up everything
00444         Cleanup( tempStrips, tempFaces );
00445 
00446         return true;
00447 }

00451 // RemapIndices()
00452 //
00453 // Function to remap your indices to improve spatial locality in your vertex buffer.
00454 //
00455 // in_primGroups: array of PrimitiveGroups you want remapped
00456 // numGroups: number of entries in in_primGroups
00457 // numVerts: number of vertices in your vertex buffer, also can be thought of as the range
00458 //  of acceptable values for indices in your primitive groups.
00459 // remappedGroups: array of remapped PrimitiveGroups
00460 //
00461 // Note that, according to the remapping handed back to you, you must reorder your 
00462 //  vertex buffer.
00463 //
00464 void RemapIndices( const PrimitiveGroup* in_primGroups, const unsigned short numGroups,
00465                                   const unsigned short numVerts, PrimitiveGroup** remappedGroups )
00466 {
00467         ( *remappedGroups ) = new PrimitiveGroup[ numGroups ];
00468 
00469         //caches oldIndex --> newIndex conversion
00470         int *indexCache;
00471         indexCache = new int[ numVerts ];
00472         MemSet( indexCache, ( unsigned int ) -1, sizeof( int )*numVerts );
00473         
00474         //loop over primitive groups
00475         unsigned int indexCtr = 0;
00476         for( int i = 0; i < numGroups; i++ )
00477         {
00478                 unsigned int numIndices = in_primGroups[ i ].numIndices;
00479 
00480                 //init remapped group
00481                 ( *remappedGroups )[ i ].type       = in_primGroups[ i ].type;
00482                 ( *remappedGroups )[ i ].numIndices = numIndices;
00483                 ( *remappedGroups )[ i ].indices    = new unsigned short[ numIndices ];
00484 
00485                 for( int j = 0; j < numIndices; j++ )
00486                 {
00487                         int cachedIndex = indexCache[ in_primGroups[ i ].indices[ j ] ];
00488                         if( cachedIndex == -1 ) //we haven't seen this index before
00489                         {
00490                                 //point to "last" vertex in VB
00491                                 ( *remappedGroups )[ i ].indices[ j ] = indexCtr;
00492 
00493                                 //add to index cache, increment
00494                                 indexCache[ in_primGroups[ i ].indices[ j ] ] = indexCtr++;
00495                         }
00496                         else
00497                         {
00498                                 //we've seen this index before
00499                                 ( *remappedGroups )[ i ].indices[ j ] = cachedIndex;
00500                         }
00501                 }
00502         }
00503 
00504         delete[] indexCache;
00505 }
